title: How to Fix an AirTag That Won't Refresh: 9 Quick Fixes

steps.title: Get close to the AirTag.
steps.content: Get close to the AirTag. AirTags update their location every 1-2 minutes if someone with Find My device is nearby, but if no Apple devices are near your AirTag, the location won't update. [1] X Research source AirTags are not real-time trackers. They rely on a combination of Bluetooth, Find My iPhone, and Location Services to accurately report their location. If the AirTag is close to anyone with an iPhone in the Find My network, its location will update. It doesn't have to be your iPhone specifically.

steps.title: If your AirTag is missing, you can mark it lost via the Find My app.
steps.content: If your AirTag is missing, you can mark it lost via the Find My app. This will notify you if the location has been updated because someone with an iPhone or Apple device in the Find My network moved within range of your AirTag. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Find My app.
steps.content: Open the Find My app. By asking the Find My app to give you directions to your AirTag, the AirTag's location may refresh. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Items.
steps.content: Tap Items . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select the AirTag you want to refresh.
steps.content: Select the AirTag you want to refresh.

steps.title: Tap Find Nearby if you're close to your AirTag.
steps.content: Tap Find Nearby if you're close to your AirTag. If your AirTag is within Bluetooth range, you'll see this option on the screen. It has a green arrow and is next to the Play Sound button. [5] X Research source If you don't see Find Nearby , open your iPhone's Settings , go to Privacy & Security > Location Services , and make sure Location Services is enabled. Then, scroll down, tap Find My , and enable Precise Location . [6] X Research source If you still don't see Find Nearby , your AirTag isn't close enough to your iPhone. Tap Directions to locate it on a map so you can get close enough to find it. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to find your AirTag.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to find your AirTag. If you don't see your AirTag on the map, move around until your phone connects to the AirTag.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings app. AirTag relies on Location Services being on, so if Location Services got turned off on your phone you may not be able to accurately find your AirTag using Find My. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select Privacy & Security.
steps.content: Select Privacy & Security . You will have to scroll down a little to find this section, and the menu item has an icon of a white hand in a blue square.

steps.title: Ensure Location Services is toggled on.
steps.content: Ensure Location Services is toggled on. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Settings app.
steps.content: Open your Settings app. AirTags also use the Find My network, so your AirTag may not work properly if you have Find My iPhone turned off. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your name at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap your name at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Find My.
steps.content: Tap Find My . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Find My iPhone at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap Find My iPhone at the top of the screen. If Find My is already on, it will say On on the menu item. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle on Find My iPhone.
steps.content: Toggle on Find My iPhone. At this point, try reopening the Find My app to see if your AirTag location has updated.

steps.title: Open your Settings app.
steps.content: Open your Settings app. AirTags utilize Bluetooth , so if your Bluetooth is turned off you may experience issues with your AirTag's location updating properly. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Bluetooth.
steps.content: Tap Bluetooth . If Bluetooth is already on, it will say On on the menu item.

steps.title: Toggle on Bluetooth.
steps.content: Toggle on Bluetooth. Now that Bluetooth is on, check the Find My app to see your AirTag's updated location.

steps.title: Open your Settings app.
steps.content: Open your Settings app. Airplane Mode turns off all of your network connections, and it can be an easy way to refresh those connections to clear out any bugs or glitches that might be occurring that interfere with your AirTag's location.

steps.title: Toggle on Airplane Mode.
steps.content: Toggle on Airplane Mode. It's near the top of the screen and has a yellow icon with a white airplane. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle off Airplane Mode after a few moments.
steps.content: Toggle off Airplane Mode after a few moments. Your Wi-Fi and cellular connections should reconnect after a few seconds.

steps.title: Open your Settings app.
steps.content: Open your Settings app. AirTags don't use Wi-Fi or your cellular network, but you'll need to be connected to the internet to use the Find My app to check your AirTag's location. If your connection has lapsed, you may experience issues updating your AirTag's location on your iPhone. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Tap on Wi-Fi . If you're already connected to Wi-Fi, it will say On next to the menu item. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Connect to a Wi-Fi network.
steps.content: Connect to a Wi-Fi network. Select any network you have access to, and enter the password if necessary. [17] X Research source If you can't connect to Wi-Fi , ensure cellular data is still on by tapping Cellular from the main Settings menu and ensuring Cellular Data is toggled on.

steps.title: Open the Find My app.
steps.content: Open the Find My app. If your AirTag's location isn't refreshing, removing it from Find My and adding it again may help reset the location. [18] X Research source This method will only work if the AirTag is nearby, not if it's lost.

steps.title: Go to the Items tab.
steps.content: Go to the Items tab. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Select the AirTag you want to refresh.
steps.content: Select the AirTag you want to refresh.

steps.title: Scroll up to show all of the AirTag's options.
steps.content: Scroll up to show all of the AirTag's options.

steps.title: Select the red Remove Item option.
steps.content: Select the red Remove Item option. A screen will come up confirming what will happen when you remove the AirTag. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Remove at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap Remove at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Remove again.
steps.content: Tap Remove again. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Add the AirTag back once it has been fully removed.
steps.content: Add the AirTag back once it has been fully removed. Add the AirTag back to your device to see if it helps with the location not updating. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Unscrew the battery cover.
steps.content: Unscrew the battery cover. Press down on the stainless steel battery cover on your AirTag and rotate counterclockwise. [23] X Research source If your AirTag battery is low, it may have trouble updating its location properly. This method can only be completed if the AirTag is with you, not if it's missing.

steps.title: Lift the cover and remove the battery.
steps.content: Lift the cover and remove the battery. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Insert a new CR2032 lithium 3V coin battery into the AirTag.
steps.content: Insert a new CR2032 lithium 3V coin battery into the AirTag. Make sure to use a battery that doesn't have a bitterant coating, as these batteries may not work in your AirTag. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Replace the cover.
steps.content: Replace the cover. Make sure the tabs on the battery cover align with the slots on your AirTag, then rotate the cover clockwise until it stops moving. [26] X Research source
